alert.note: Alert for Clarke (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 03 at 10:12PM CST by NWS Mobile
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of north central Clarke County through 1045 PM CST... At 1012 PM CST, National Weather Service doppler radar indicated a strong thunderstorm 8 miles west of Thomasville, moving northeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of north central Clarke County. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 400 AM CST for southwestern Alabama.
